properties.areaDesc: Santa Fe Metro Area; Middle Rio Grande Valley/Albuquerque Metro Area; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass
properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 10 at 11:17AM MST until February 11 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
...COLDER TEMPERATURES, MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW, AND WINDY
CONDITIONS TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT...

.A significant winter storm will move over New Mexico tonight
through Tuesday night when many areas of northern and central New
Mexico can expect moderate to heavy snowfall and colder
temperatures. In addition, periods of strong and gusty winds will
create areas of blowing snow in central New Mexico focusing
through the middle Rio Grande Valley from Santa Fe to Albuquerque
to Socorro. Residents and travelers through much of northern and
central New Mexico can expect significant travel impacts tonight
through Tuesday night.

* WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 6
inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph around Santa Fe and
Glorieta Pass, and as high as 60 mph below Tijeras Canyon in
Albuquerque. Lowest snowfall amounts will be below canyons,
while higher amounts are expected around northwest Rio Rancho
and northern portions of Santa Fe.

* WHERE...Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass, Santa Fe Metro
Area and Middle Rio Grande Valley including the Albuquerque
Metro Area.

* WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 11 PM MST Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could
bring down tree branches. Snow amounts will be highly variable
from the snow hole effect.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for New Mexico can be obtained by
calling 5 1 1, 1-800-432-4269, or visiting nmroads.com.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 PM MST TUESDAY
